attributes.action: Add all NHS workers who served during the COVID-19 crisis to 2020 honors list
attributes.additional_details: If ever there was a group of people who deserved this it is our ‘Army in Blue’ in recognition of their bravery and their service to the people of the UK during this unprecedented crisis.
attributes.background: Order the Honors Commitee to automatically add all NHS workers that reported for duty and served the people of the UK during the COVID-19 lockdown and award all of them individual MBEs.

rejection.details:
The Government will only accept individual nominations, not petitions, so we can’t publish your petition.

To submit a nomination for an honour, visit: http://www.gov.uk/honours/

We have published a number of petitions calling on the Government to reward and recognise NHS workers, which you might like to sign:

Increase pay for NHS healthcare workers and recognise their work: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300073

Award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

A medal to honour the fortitude of people working in essential occupations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308035

Designate a day for the recognition of our NHS and all Emergency Services: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308614

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
